visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly trend variations with dynamic min/max annotations using synthetic time-series data and Highcharts annotations API

visualization_code.CSS: #container { max-width: 800px; margin: 20px auto; border: 1px solid #e0e0e0; border-radius: 8px; padding: 15px; }

visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a univariate time series with 12 monthly observations. Temporal dimension uses ISO-8601 dates while the performance metric is a continuous numerical variable. Synthetic data generation followed three principles: 1) Base trend of μ=84.2 with σ=8.7 variability, 2) Seasonal pattern with Q2/Q4 peaks, 3) Random normal noise (ε ~ N(0, 3.5)). Data ranges maintain domain validity (0-100 index scale). The spline chart was chosen to emphasize trend continuity while maximizing data-ink ratio through axis simplification. Annotations employ Cairo's preattentive attributes (color-coded labels, positional encoding) for immediate pattern recognition. The horizontal connector implements Tufte's principle of minimal contrast for secondary elements. Statistical validity is maintained through μ=84.2 ±8.7 SD, with seasonal variation amplitude of 14.9 points between quarterly extremes.
